classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D2, E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division C should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Upper-Division C cannot be fulfilled with Ethnic Studies courses. Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Any Free Elective course can go here.

Free Electives: Some Free Electives may need to be 300-400 level to ensure completion of the required minimum of 60 units of upper division. If GE courses, taken for a letter grade, are also counted as Approved Electives in the major, the number of Free Electives units is increased to reach the minimum 180 total. Consult college advisor for additional information.

Any Approved Elective course can go here.

Some courses may require prerequisites to be used as Free Electives. Consultation with Advisor recommended. See catalog. Approved Electives: See Cal poly Course Catalog and Ethnic Studies Department/Advisor for approved courses. These 24 elective units can be chosen from any unused ES prefix or those provided in the catalog. Courses not on the list may still be chosen, subject to department approval. Some Approved Electives may also fulfill GE requirements, in which case Free Electives will be needed to reach the 180 units required for this degree.

Free Electives: Some Free Electives may need to be 300-400 level to ensure completion of the required minimum 60 units of upper-division. If GE courses, taken, for a letter grade, are also counted as Approved Electives in the major, the number of Free Elective units is increased to reach the minimum 180 units total. Consult a college advisor for additional information.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR course or GWR exam can go here. Refer to the current catalog for prerequisites.
